chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: Slime is a jEdit plugin influenced by SLIME (Superior Lisp Interaction Mode for Emacs). It provides a shell in Console that allows you to have an interactive REPL session (Read Eval Print Loop) running at all times, with actions to evaluate inside it the currently-selected text, the active buffer, or an external file.
Each REPL is provided as a separate shell for the Console plugin. You can easily disable shells that you don't plan on using in Slime's plugin options window.
This version of Slime comes with support for Clojure, Groovy, and Python.
chapter.sect1:
Clojure To use the Clojure REPL, you need one of two things:
An executable with the name "clojure" on your system path (Windows batch files should have the .bat extension)
An environment variable named "CLOJURE_DIR" whose value is the directory that the clojure jar is in (which should be named simply "clojure.jar")

Groovy To use the Groovy REPL, you need one of two things:
The "bin" subfolder of groovy's home on your system path (typing "groovysh" into a terminal or command prompt should bring up the REPL).
An environment variable named "GROOVY_HOME" that points to groovy's home folder.
Python To use the Python REPL, you must have the python executable somewhere on your system path.
